revised_title: Infra-Red Dichroism and Crystal Structure: Adipic Acid and Diketopiperazine
tldr: The authors used polarized infra-red radiation to study the crystal structure of adipic acid and diketopiperazine. They found that the direction of the changing dipole moment in the crystals could be calculated from simple measurements of optical density of the absorption bands. The results agreed with the crystal structures derived from X-ray spectra when the usual assumptions about angles were made. This method can be used as an adjunct to X-ray methods for crystal structure determination.
